intro: Tetrazygiopsis biflora, commonly known as the two-flowered tetrazygiopsis, is a rare and delicate flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and finely divided, fern-like leaves. Native to specific regions of southern Africa, it thrives in moist, shaded environments. The plant's unique floral structure and limited distribution make it a subject of interest for botanists. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
